hero.title: EarthBloom
hero.subtitle: NASA
hero.description: Satellite monitoring of flowering patterns in collaboration with NASA Open Data. Discover the beauty of Mexico's endemic flowers through citizen science and space technology.

intro.title: Observe. Learn. Bloom.
intro.description: Intelligent platform to monitor and predict flowering at spatial and temporal scales. Integrates satellite data, weather stations, historical phenological series, and observations. Generates probability maps of flowering by species and by pixel. This allows directing field sampling, optimizing resources, and offering local calendars for tourism, festivals, and municipal management. Learn about the diversity of Mexican flora.

satellite.title: NASA Satellite Science
satellite.description: We use data from NASA observatories and missions (vegetation indices, surface temperature, soil moisture, cloudiness) to detect and monitor flowering patterns at regional and national scales with high spatial and temporal coverage.

crowdsourcing.title: Crowdsourcing and validation
crowdsourcing.description: We integrate field observations contributed by the community and experts (georeferenced photos, dates and phenophases) with quality controls and cross-verification. These contributions feed our flowering models and maps, expanding spatial/temporal coverage and improving near-real-time accuracy.

alerts.title: Flowering Alerts and Calendars
alerts.description: We generate operational maps and calendars with peak flowering windows, confidence levels, and priority areas. This enables tourism planning, monitoring logistics, and decision-making for conservation and local management.

flowers.title: Mexican Flower Species
flowers.subtitle: Discover the diversity of Mexico's endemic flora monitored through NASA's satellite technology.

huasteca.name: Huasteca Potosina
huasteca.description: Low jungles and humid climates that favor abundant flowering during spring and summer.

jalisco.name: Jalisco
jalisco.description: Transition between temperate forests and low jungles, with flowering marked by the rainy season.

cdmx.name: Mexico City
cdmx.description: Urban-forest transition with summer rains; flowering peaks from late spring to autumn.

map.title: Flowering Map
map.description: Real-time monitoring of flowering areas in Mexico using NASA's satellite data.
